newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Thailand's Narongchai says not in new cabinet.
newsitem.headline: Thailand's Narongchai says not in new cabinet.

text.p: The chairman and chief executive officer of Thailand's General Finance and Security Co Ltd, Narongchai Akrasanee, said in Hong Kong on Tuesday he was not a part of a new Thai cabinet being formed, but was an insider.

"Dr Amnuay (Viravan) is forming an economic cabinet in Hong Kong. I've not been included in the cabinet," Narongchai, who went on to describe himself as an insider, told reporters after addressing an Asia Society luncheon meeting in Hong Kong.

Amnuay, Thailand's current deputy prime minister and minister of foreign affairs, is visiting Hong Kong to address a World Economic Forum meeting. He said on Monday he was considering an offer to take over the economics ministry of a coalition government now being formed.
Narongchai had previously served as an economic adviser to Amnuay.
Narongchai expressed optimism about the state of the Thai economy.
"I cannot help feeling optimistic about the prospect that we will have a recovery and a more stable economy starting from 1997," he said.
He said he expected economic growth this year to be "maybe six percent" and saw exports growing by maybe three to five percent.
Narongchai said he viewed a plunge in the Thai stock market on Monday after Sunday's election as a temporary blip.
"By the end of the day I think the whole market will recover to the level of before yesterday."
Thai stocks gained sharply in the morning session to 971.07 by the lunchbreak, up 3.05 percent.
